==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|けい|む|しょ|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
Appears to be a coinage in Japan as a replacement for the {{etyl|zh|-}}-derived term {{m|ja|監獄|tr=kangoku||prison, jail}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>  Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=けいむしょ|刑|tr1=kei|t1=penance, penalty|務|tr2=mu|t2=work; something that must be done|所|tr3=sho|t3=place}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|けいむしょ|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5|acc2=0|acc2_ref=DJR,SMK5|acc3=4|acc3_ref=SMK5}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|けいむしょ}}

# A [[prison]], a [[jail]], a [[penitentiary]].
#: {{ja-usex|'''刑務所'''に入れる|'''けいむしょ''' に いれる|to put someone in '''prison''', to im'''prison'''}}

====Derived terms====
* {{ja-r|刑務所長|けいむしょ-ちょう}}: A prison [[governor]] (UK), a prison [[warden]] (US).
